      public final gdi.game.animations.AbstractAnimation addMoveAnimationForY(ArrayList<gdi.game.animations.Keyframe> keyframes, boolean smooth, boolean offsetAnimation, gdi.game.animations.AbstractAnimation.Delegate delegateOrNull)

    • moveTo

      public void moveTo(double x, double y, double deltaTime, boolean smooth, gdi.game.animations.AbstractAnimation.Delegate delegateOrNull)
      Description copied from class: Sprite
      Creates an animation that moves the sprite form its current position to the specified location. This method will internally create two Instances of KeyframeAnimation to change the x and y positions over time. The animations are started synchronous.
      Overrides:
      moveTo in class Sprite
      Parameters:
      x - The targeted horizontal position
      y - The targeted vertical position
      deltaTime - The time the animation should run. If this value is negative it is interpreted as a speed in pixels/second
      smooth - true if the animation should ease in and out (see KeyframeAnimation.Smooth and KeyframeAnimation.smooth(boolean))
      delegateOrNull - An object that is notified once the animation starts and stops.

    • moveTo

      public void moveTo(List<gdi.util.math.Vec2D> locations, double deltaTime, boolean smooth, gdi.game.animations.AbstractAnimation.Delegate delegateOrNull)
      Description copied from class: Sprite
      Creates an animation that moves the sprite form its current position to the specified location. This method will internally create two Instances of KeyframeAnimation to change the x and y positions over time. The animations are started synchronous.
      This Method will ignore all waypoints that do not change with respect to the previous waypoint.
      Overrides:
      moveTo in class Sprite
      Parameters:
      locations - a list of Positions
      deltaTime - The time the animation should run between two consecutive locations. If this value is negative it is interpreted as a speed in pixels/second
      smooth - true if the animation should ease in and out (see KeyframeAnimation.Smooth and KeyframeAnimation.smooth(boolean))
      delegateOrNull - An object that is notified once the animation starts and stops.
